title: Trials in the Square
outcome: Neighborhood assemblies take control, organize public tribunals in city squares where Council members must answer for BCI abuses and hidden interventions in citizens’ lives. Collapsed Council unity, historical confessions, and dramatic verdicts reshape Stenograd.

events.description: Neighborhood assemblies establish mobile tribunals in major squares. Council members are brought before crowds to answer for their decisions during the BCI era.
Confession sessions reveal hidden interventions and secret orders from the period after Halden's death, including forced disappearances and manipulated BCI scores.
Factional rifts widen. Former Harmonists and Innovators blame the Directorate for most abuses, but evidence reveals all factions flexed the rules.
Verdicts are reached: some Council members are exiled, others imprisoned, a few are shown mercy. The city shifts to neighborhood-based governance, rejecting automated rule.
